channel.title: Getting the Compiler to Work
channel.description:
So I download Project Awesomness 562 (PA562) but I can't get the Compiler to work. I'm really tired and need to head to bed so can one of you fellow, awesome, peeps fix the problem? My eyes are just wanting to close on me :(
[code]@echo off title QuestScape compiler echo Preparing... mkdir bin cd src/com copy log4j.xml .. cd .. move log4j.xml bin
echo Compiling nets... "C:\program files\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin\javac" -d bin -cp
deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-
1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-
1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-
20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar -sourcepath
src src/com/rs2hd/net/*.java
echo Compiling models... "C:\program files\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin\javac" -d bin -cp
deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-
1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-
1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-
20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar -sourcepath
src src/com/rs2hd/model/*.java
echo Compiling packet handlers... "C:\program files\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin\javac" -d bin -cp
deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-
1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-
1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-
20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar -sourcepath
src src/com/rs2hd/packethandler/*.java
echo Compiling utils... "C:\program files\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin\javac" -d bin -cp
deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-
1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-
1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-
20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar -sourcepath
src src/com/rs2hd/util/*.java
echo Compiling shops... "C:\program files\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin\javac" -d bin -cp
deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-
1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-
1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-
20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar -sourcepath
src src/com/rs2hd/content/Shops.java
"C:\program files\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin\javac" -d bin -cp
deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-
1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-
1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-
20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar -sourcepath
src src/com/rs2hd/content/ShopHandler.java echo Complete. pause
[/code]
Note that the path locations and stuff is right but I get this error:
[code] Preparing... A subdirectory or file bin already exists. 1 file(s) copied. 1 file(s) moved. Compiling nets... javac: file not found: src\com\rs2hd\net\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Compiling models... javac: file not found: src\com\rs2hd\model\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Compiling packet handlers... javac: file not found: src\com\rs2hd\packethandler\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Compiling utils... javac: file not found: src\com\rs2hd\util\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Compiling shops... javac: file not found: src\com\rs2hd\content\Shops.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options javac: file not found: src\com\rs2hd\content\ShopHandler.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Complete. Press any key to continue . . . [/code]
Hopefully someone can enlighten me. To be honest though, if someone would point me in the right direction instead of just giving me the answer I would like that more because I like to do trail and error and I feel I learn more doing it that way. Thanks!

item.title: Getting the Compiler to Work
item.dc:creator: @Born_To_Code Born To Code
item.description:
@Born_To_Code wrote:

Ah thanks alot guys! I appreciate it

Read full topic

item.title: Getting the Compiler to Work
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

No problem.
Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations.Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. < Thats fine, just think of it as a good to go message as in rsps it doesn’t really change much(whack is correct).

Read full topic

item.title: Getting the Compiler to Work
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

Those are notices, kind of like mild, mild, mild warnings. But generally about the ones you are receiving, you shouldn’t worry too much about them unless you’re a diehard programmer.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting the Compiler to Work
item.dc:creator: @Born_To_Code Born To Code
item.description:
@Born_To_Code wrote:

Yes, all the files that need to be compiled in the folder have the java extension. You was right, it had to do with the new bin being made and stuff but I get this now.

Preparing... Compiling nets... Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. Compiling models... Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. Compiling packet handlers... Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. Compiling utils... Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. Compiling shops... Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. Complete. Press any key to continue . . .

What should do I about the the 2 notes? I’ve never ran into a problem like this before so I’m kinda blown away by it. Thanks for the help so far

Read full topic

item.title: Getting the Compiler to Work
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

javac: file not found: src\com\rs2hd\net*.java
javac: file not found: src\com\rs2hd\model*.java
Why is there an *? or are the files called *.java?
Also, this part might change whats happening, I think its moving the files so your paths turn incorrect?

For windows don’t you use / ? Or can you use both(I think both but jw cause I always thought / means its going -> that way and \ was different cause its linux).

Read full topic

item.title: Getting the Compiler to Work
item.dc:creator: @Born_To_Code Born To Code
item.description:
@Born_To_Code wrote:

So I download Project Awesomness 562 (PA562) but I can’t get the Compiler to work. I’m really tired and need to head to bed so can one of you fellow, awesome, peeps fix the problem? My eyes are just wanting to close on me

[code]@echo off
title QuestScape compiler
echo Preparing…
mkdir bin
cd src/com
copy log4j.xml …
cd …
move log4j.xml bin

echo Compiling nets…
“C:\program files\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin\javac” -d bin -cp

deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-

1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-

1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-

20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar -sourcepath

src src/com/rs2hd/net/*.java

echo Compiling models…
“C:\program files\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin\javac” -d bin -cp

deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-

1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-

1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-

20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar -sourcepath

src src/com/rs2hd/model/*.java

echo Compiling packet handlers…
“C:\program files\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin\javac” -d bin -cp

deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-

1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-

1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-

20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar -sourcepath

src src/com/rs2hd/packethandler/*.java

echo Compiling utils…
“C:\program files\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin\javac” -d bin -cp

deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-

1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-

1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-

20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar -sourcepath

src src/com/rs2hd/util/*.java

echo Compiling shops…
“C:\program files\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin\javac” -d bin -cp

deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-

1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-

1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-

20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar -sourcepath

src src/com/rs2hd/content/Shops.java

“C:\program files\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin\javac” -d bin -cp

deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-

1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-

1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-

20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar -sourcepath

src src/com/rs2hd/content/ShopHandler.java
echo Complete.
pause

[/code]

Note that the path locations and stuff is right but I get this error:

Preparing...
A subdirectory or file bin already exists.
        1 file(s) copied.
        1 file(s) moved.
Compiling nets...
javac: file not found: src\com\rs2hd\net\*.java
Usage: javac <options> <source files>
use -help for a list of possible options
Compiling models...
javac: file not found: src\com\rs2hd\model\*.java
Usage: javac <options> <source files>
use -help for a list of possible options
Compiling packet handlers...
javac: file not found: src\com\rs2hd\packethandler\*.java
Usage: javac <options> <source files>
use -help for a list of possible options
Compiling utils...

Usage: javac <options> <source files>
use -help for a list of possible options
Compiling shops...

Usage: javac <options> <source files>
use -help for a list of possible options
javac: file not found: src\com\rs2hd\content\ShopHandler.java
Usage: javac <options> <source files>
use -help for a list of possible options
Complete.
Press any key to continue . . .

Hopefully someone can enlighten me. To be honest though, if someone would point me in the right direction instead of just giving me the answer I would like that more because I like to do trail and error and I feel I learn more doing it that way. Thanks!
